info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:51PM CDT until July 15 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...In Wisconsin, Ashland, Bayfield and Douglas Counties.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 251 PM CDT Tuesday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashland, Hawthorne, Iron River, Lake Nebagamon, Maple, Barksdale, Brule, Poplar, Town of Delta, Ino, Benoit, Odanah, Bennett, Mason, Moquah, Blueberry, Bad River Reservation, Lyman Lake, New Odanah and Amnicon Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Ashland, WI; Bayfield, WI; Douglas, WI
